disease: Whooping cough due to other Bordetella species without pneumonia

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be severe and paroxysmal
symptoms.pattern: Initially mild, resembling a common cold; progresses to severe, spasmodic coughing fits with characteristic inspiratory 'whoop' and post-tussive emesis

required: Clinical presentation consistent with whooping cough (paroxysmal cough, whoop, post-tussive emesis)
supportive: Exposure to someone with whooping cough
